message: Compare http://www.djangoproject.com/community/packages/ with the latest 5 apps on http://www.djangopackages.com. No comparison. I've submitted the DP latest packages feed but it is not getting picked up. I've reported this in IRC, email and twitter. Should I open a ticket?
+1, this would be great.  http://www.djangoproject.com/community/packages/ makes it look as if Django hardly has any regularly-updated packages.

judging from this - you just find a person with admin access to the site and poke them hard enough to get the feed added: http://code.djangoproject.com/browser/djangoproject.com/django_website/apps/aggregator
@pydanny Not sure what's going on there -- I can confirm that http://djangopackages.com/feeds/packages/latest/atom/ is in our list of feeds
@pydanny Best guess would be that there is a cron job that hasn't run yet
The people to bug will be @justinlilly and @jezdez -- Justin wrote the community pages, and Jannis has root on the web box.
@pydanny Opening a ticket would have been the best way, thanks.
Fixed now. Again, please open a ticket next time, we can't roam all online resources for potential bugs all the time.
alright - wasn't sure since the ticket categories was unclear.
@jezdez To be fair, he came here asking whether to open a ticket - not to file a bug report.
@pydanny there is a ticket component called "Django Web site", that's usually what fits best
